Package com.accele.gage

Class Registry<T extends Indexable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.Registry<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of Indexable object this registry will store
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable
    public class Registry<T extends Indexable>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cleanable
    A general-purpose storage class for engine resources.

    All objects used in GAGE must be registered in an instance of this class. The main GAGE class contains the registries for all engine resources.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland
    See Also:
    GAGE, Indexable

    • Method Detail

      • addEntryAddCallback

        public void addEntryAddCallback​(RegistryCallback<T> callback)
        Adds an entry-add callback to this Registry. The callback will be invoked whenever an entry is added to the registry.
        Parameters:
        callback - the RegistryCallback to add

      • addEntryRemoveCallback

        public void addEntryRemoveCallback​(RegistryCallback<T> callback)
        Adds an entry-remove callback to this Registry. The callback will be invoked whenever an entry is removed from the registry.
        Parameters:
        callback - the RegistryCallback to add

      • register

        public void register​(T entry)
        Registers the specified entry to this Registry.

        An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the registry already contains an entry with the same registry ID as the argument. All RegistryCallbacks in the entry-add callback list will be invoked if the entry can be registered.

        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the registry already contains an entry with the same registry ID as the argument

      • registerAll

        @SafeVarargs
public final void registerAll​(T... entries)
        Registers the specified entries to this Registry.

        An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the registry already contains an entry with the same registry ID as the argument. All RegistryCallbacks in the entry-add callback list will be invoked for each entry that can be registered.

        Parameters:
        entries - the entries to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the registry already contains an entry with the same registry ID as the argument

      • registerAll

        public void registerAll​(java.util.Collection<T> entries)
        Registers the specified entries to this Registry.

        An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the registry already contains an entry with the same registry ID as the argument. All RegistryCallbacks in the entry-add callback list will be invoked for each entry that can be registered.

        Parameters:
        entries - the entries to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the registry already contains an entry with the same registry ID as the argument

      • getEntry

        public T getEntry​(java.lang.String id)
        Returns the entry with the specified id.

        An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the registry does not contain an entry with the specified registry ID.

        Parameters:
        id - the registry ID of the target entry
        Returns:
        the entry with the specified id
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the registry does not contain an entry with the specified registry ID

      • removeEntry

        public T removeEntry​(java.lang.String id)
        Removes the entry with the specified id and returns the entry.

        An IllegalArgumentException will be thrown if the registry does not contain an entry with the specified registry ID. All RegistryCallbacks in the entry-remove callback list will be invoked if the entry exists.

        Parameters:
        id - the registry ID of the target entry
        Returns:
        the entry with the specified id
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the registry does not contain an entry with the specified registry ID

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all entries from the Registry.

        All RegistryCallbacks in the entry-remove callback list will be invoked for each entry in the Registry.

      • getEntries

        public java.util.Collection<T> getEntries()
        Returns an immutable view of all entries in the Registry.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable Collection of all entries in the Registry

      • clean

        public void clean()
        Description copied from interface: Cleanable
        Allows the implementer to perform any necessary cleanup tasks. For most engine-specific resources, this method should not be called manually as it is usually always called after stop() has been called.
        Specified by:
        clean in interface Cleanable
